required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft
clinical_study.official_title: Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: The Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft study is a clinical trial approved by US FDA to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft indicated for the treatment of patients with aneurysms/ulcers of the descending thoracic aorta having vessel structure suitable for repair.

primary_outcome.description: Major adverse event is defined as: All-cause death; Q-wave MI; cardiac event involving arrest, resuscitation, or balloon pump; ventilation > 72 hours or re-intubation; pulmonary event requiring tracheostomy or chest tube; renal failure requiring permanent dialysis, hemofiltration, or kidney transplant in a patient with a normal pre-procedure serum creatinine level; bowel resection; stroke; paralysis; amputation involving more than toes; aneurysm or vessel leak requiring re-operation; deep vein thrombosis requiring surgical or lytic therapy; pulmonary embolism involving hemodynamic instability or surgery; coagulopathy requiring surgery; or wound complication requiring return to the operating room.

Device failure is defined as: Technical failure (inability to access or deploy the Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft or loss of patency at the time of deployment completion), or any of the following: type I or type III endoleaks requiring re-intervention, aneurysm rupture or conversion to open surgical repair, aneurysm enlargement greater than 0.5 cm.

arm_group.description: Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft (Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm)

intervention.intervention_name: Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft
intervention.description: Endovascular treatment of patients with aneurysms/ulcers of the descending thoracic aorta having morphology suitable for endovascular repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Descending thoracic aneurysm with diameter ≥ 5.0 cm
- Descending thoracic aneurysm with a history of growth ≥ 0.5 cm per year
- Descending thoracic degenerative or atherosclerotic ulcer ≥ 10 mm in depth and 20 mm in diameter
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 18 years of age
- Life expectancy less than 2 years
- Pregnant or breastfeeding or planning on becoming pregnant within 60 months
- Unwilling to comply with the follow-up schedule
- Inability or refusal to give informed consent
- Less than 30 days beyond primary endpoint for other investigative drug or device study

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania

link.description: Click here for more information about thoracic aortic aneurysms (TAA), aortic ulcers, and the Zenith TX2 Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft Clinical Study.

outcome.title: Patients With Major Adverse Events (MAE)
outcome.description: Major adverse event is defined as: All-cause death; Q-wave MI; cardiac event involving arrest, resuscitation, or balloon pump; ventilation > 72 hours or re-intubation; pulmonary event requiring tracheostomy or chest tube; renal failure requiring permanent dialysis, hemofiltration, or kidney transplant in a patient with a normal pre-procedure serum creatinine level; bowel resection; stroke; paralysis; amputation involving more than toes; aneurysm or vessel leak requiring re-operation; deep vein thrombosis requiring surgical or lytic therapy; pulmonary embolism involving hemodynamic instability or surgery; coagulopathy requiring surgery; or wound complication requiring return to the operating room.
outcome.population: 1 patient had a stroke and required ventilation >72 hours/reintubation.

group.title: Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft
group.description: Endovascular treatment of patients with aneurysms/ulcers of the descending thoracic aorta having morphology suitable for endovascular repair

measure.title: Patients With Major Adverse Events (MAE)
measure.description: Major adverse event is defined as: All-cause death; Q-wave MI; cardiac event involving arrest, resuscitation, or balloon pump; ventilation > 72 hours or re-intubation; pulmonary event requiring tracheostomy or chest tube; renal failure requiring permanent dialysis, hemofiltration, or kidney transplant in a patient with a normal pre-procedure serum creatinine level; bowel resection; stroke; paralysis; amputation involving more than toes; aneurysm or vessel leak requiring re-operation; deep vein thrombosis requiring surgical or lytic therapy; pulmonary embolism involving hemodynamic instability or surgery; coagulopathy requiring surgery; or wound complication requiring return to the operating room.
measure.population: 1 patient had a stroke and required ventilation >72 hours/reintubation.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: The 30-day freedom from MAE for patients treated with the Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft does not meet the performance goal of 80.6%.
analysis.param_type: Free from major adverse event rate (%)

outcome.title: Patients With Device Failures
outcome.description: Device failure is defined as: Technical failure (inability to access or deploy the Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft or loss of patency at the time of deployment completion), or any of the following: type I or type III endoleaks requiring re-intervention, aneurysm rupture or conversion to open surgical repair, aneurysm enlargement greater than 0.5 cm.

class.title: Did not receive the device (technical failures)
Aneurysm growth>5 mm and conversion to open repair

analysis.groups_desc: Null Hypothesis: The 12-month device success for patients treated with the Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft does not meet the performance goal of 80.7%.

group.title: Zenith® TX2® Low Profile TAA Endovascular Graft
group.description: Endovascular treatment of patients with aneurysms/ulcers of the descending thoracic aorta having morphology suitable for endovascular repair

event.sub_title: Decompensated heart insufficiency with numbness of lower neck
Cholangitis result of stenosis of papillae vaterii
Colon cancer (descending colon, sigmoid, colon, rectum)
Intermittent Left Lower Quadrant (LLQ), abdominal pain
Planned visit for changing stent in choledochus stent at benign stenosis of papillae
Patient fell and broke several bones in the arm requiring 2 surgeries
event.description: 2 surgeries: 1 to clean out the injuries and 1 to treat the broken bones

event.sub_title: Screw removal after ankle joint fracture before enrollment
Chronic right shoulder pain with muscle rupture and bursitis
Craniotomy to treat pre-existing Anaplastic Astrocytoma
Intra-thecal foreign body (tip of lumbar drain lost in spinal canal prior to procedure)
Left lower extremity weakness resulting in falls
Mucous and blood plug of left mainstem
Pulmonary nodule- right middle lobe, diagnosed with non-small lung cancer following right middle lob
Left internal carotid artery stenosis, condition present at time of study enrollment
Right iliac artery occlusion present at index procedure

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Scott Snyder, PhD, Director of Clinical Science & Biostatistics
